interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Iron Man (Two-Disc Ultimate Edition + BD Live) [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2009/01/08
Store: Robert Downey Jr.  (Actor),     Gwyneth Paltrow  (Actor),     Jon Favreau  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Suit up for action with Robert Downey Jr. in the ultimate adventure movie you\x92ve been waiting for,', 'Iron Man', '! When jet-setting genius-industrialist Tony Stark is captured in enemy territory, he builds a high-tech suit of armor to escape. Now, he\x92s on a mission to save the world as a hero who\x92s built, not born, to be unlike any other. Co-starring Gwyneth Paltrow, Terrence Howard and Jeff Bridges, it\x92s a fantastic, high-flying journey that is "hugely entertaining" (Joe Morgenstern, The Wall Street Journal).', 'Amazon.com', "You know you're going to get a different kind of superhero when you cast Robert Downey Jr. in the lead role. And", 'Iron Man', "is different, in welcome ways. Cleverly updated from Marvel Comics' longstanding series,", 'Iron Man', "puts billionaire industrialist Tony Stark (that's Downey) in the path of some Middle Eastern terrorists; in a brilliantly paced section, Stark invents an indestructible suit that allows him to escape. If the rest of the movie never quit hits that precise rhythm again, it nevertheless offers plenty of pleasure, as the renewed Stark swears off his past as a weapons manufacturer, develops his new Iron Man suit, and puzzles both his business partner (Jeff Bridges in great form) and executive assistant (Gwyneth Paltrow). Director Jon Favreau geeks out in fun ways with the hardware, but never lets it overpower the movie, and there's always a goofy one-liner or a slapstick pratfall around to break the tension. As for Downey, he doesn't get to jitterbug around too much in his improv way, but he brings enough of his unpredictable personality to keep the thing fresh. And listen up, hardcore Marvel mavens: even if you know the Stan Lee cameo is coming, you won't be able to guess it until it's on the screen. It all builds to a splendid final scene, with a concluding line delivery by Downey that just feels absolutely right.", '--Robert Horton', 'Stills from', 'Iron Man', '(Click for larger image)']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Jon Favreau, Robert Downey Jr., Terrence Howard, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jeff Bridges', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jon Favreau', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 30, 2008', 'Actors': 'Robert Downey Jr., Gwyneth Paltrow, Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: This was an excellent movie... probably one of Robert Downy Jr.'s best.  Unlike most Blu-ray movies that are older that have been converted to blu-ray, this one (being so new) was meant for Blu-ray.  It is truly incredible in HD.  The colors are so vibrant and you can see ever little detail on our 52" Sony Bravia.  This is worth every penny!
Review Title: Great movie... and even more incredible on Blu-ray
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Italian Job [Blu-ray]
Donald Sutherland  (Actor),     Mark Wahlberg  (Actor),     F. Gary Gray  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['The plan was flawless. The execution was perfect. Charlie Croker pulled off the crime of a lifetime. The one thing that he didn\'t plan on was being double-crossed. Now he wants more than the job\'s payoff... he wants payback. Mark Wahlberg is electrifying as Croker in this "fast and furious action-adventure." Along with a drop-dead gorgeous safecracker (Charlize Theron), Croker and his team take off to re-steal the loot and end up in a pulse-pounding, pedal-to-the-metal chase that careens up, down and below the streets of Los Angeles. With an ensemble all-star cast that also includes Edward Norton, Seth Green, Jason Statham, Mos Def, Franky G and Donald Sutherland, the Italian Job is hot!']

Gary Gray', 'Media Format': "Blu-ray, Multiple Formats, Special Edition, Widescreen, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Dolby, Collector's Edition, Color, Subtitled", 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 3, 2008', 'Actors': 'Donald Sutherland, Mark Wahlberg, Edward Norton, Charlize Theron, Jason Statham', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Donna Powers, Troy Kennedy-Martin, Wayne Powers', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
We have a top of the line Sony 52" XBR TV and Sony Blu-Ray player we purchased for Christmas and I purchased the Blu-ray version of this movie because we enjoy the movie so much.  It wasn't worth it!  It has trouble rewriting quickly during the action scenes.  We actually compared it to the regular DVD that we own and to be honest... it isn't worth the additional expense to purchase the Blu-ray.  Overall, we have noticed that with all of the older movies that have been converted to Blu-ray... they tend to be a disappointment in the blu-ray version for the same rewriting problems.  However, animations are incredible and all of the new movies that have recently been released in the theaters that are just coming out on Blu-Ray are great... like Ironman... that one was incredible on Blu-ray.
Movie is great... Blu-Ray is terrible

profile:
**User Preferences Summary:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** Maintains a strong inclination towards action and adventure films, particularly those featuring well-known actors and engaging plots.
- **Actor Affinity:** Continues to favor performers like Robert Downey Jr., Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, and Edward Norton, indicating a preference for star-studded casts.
- **Format Feedback:** Despite previous skepticism toward Blu-ray conversions of older films due to quality concerns, the user has positively reviewed a newer title, emphasizing that it was designed for Blu-ray and showcased exceptional HD quality. This suggests an openness to contemporary releases when they are tailored for the format.
- **Viewing Equipment:** Owns high-quality entertainment equipment, reinforcing serious interest in an enhanced home viewing experience.
- **Critical Reviewer:** Remains a detailed critic, providing comprehensive reviews based on firsthand interactions, with a penchant for exploring visual quality and detail in films, particularly on high-definition formats.

This user appreciates engaging films, especially those that utilize the Blu-ray format effectively, indicating a nuanced approach to media purchases that balances previous reservations with recognition of well-executed newer releases.
